name: oco2_xco2_yearly
title: CO2 Concentration (yearly)
description: The average concentration of carbon dioxide in a column of dry air extending from Earth’s surface to the top of the atmosphere.
details: The raster used is the result of aggregating one year of data to a 10km grid and then using a linear interpolation to fill gaps. The underlying data were produced by the OCO-2 project at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology, and obtained from the OCO-2 data archive maintained at the NASA Goddard Earth Science Data and Information Services Center.

extract_types_info.mean: average co2 concentration (ppm) per unit of analysis
extract_types_info.max: maximum co2 concentration (ppm) per unit of analysis
extract_types_info.min: minimum co2 concentration (ppm) per unit of analysis

options.variable_description: co2 concentration in parts per million (ppm)

extras.citation: O'Dell, C. W., Connor, B., Bösch, H., O'Brien, D., Frankenberg, C., Castano, R., Christi, M., Eldering, D., Fisher, B., Gunson, M., McDuffie, J., Miller, C. E., Natraj, V., Oyafuso, F., Polonsky, I., Smyth, M., Taylor, T., Toon, G. C., Wennberg, P. O., and Wunch, D.: The ACOS CO2 retrieval algorithm – Part 1: Description and validation against synthetic observations, Atmos. Meas. Tech., 5, 99-121, https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-5-99-2012, 2012.
